title: BrAVISE
text: BrAVISE contains two main tabs corresponding two different ways analyzing dataset: GxE analysis: allows run large range GxE analysis observation data MEANS observation unit level. words, performs second stage two-stage analysis multi-environment trials, first step complete using STABrAPP. built top statgenGxE package. Correlate: allows build complex scatter plots comparing variables different observation levels, also environment details, germplasm attributes . two components BrAVISE app share common third component manage Groups germplasms can defined various part application analysis results manual selection genotypes. Groups germplasms can merged, intersect, saved exported germplasm list BMS instance.

title: BrAVISE
text: application finished loading data, starting analysis, user needs prepare data providing different information. Mandatory information fields red : Trait, Germplasm Level, Variable use Environment Name.  First need pick trait GxE analysis conducted trait trait. Indeed, BrAVISE interactive application way launch analysis different traits batch mode. Trait picker input, MEANS variables listed. default variables ends BLUEs BLUPs suffix (can changed app configuration parameter). selected variable ends BLUEs BLUPs, Use weights switch automatically activated corresponding seBLUEs seBLUPs variable selected weight variable defined 1/seBLUEs^2 1/seBLUPS^2. Germplasm level needs selected. can either GermplasmDbId GermplasmName. Choosing one may impact way genotypes aggregated different environments. Indeed, may genotype evaluated different environments locations years different germplasmDbIds (e.g. corresponding different cycles multiplication). case may prefer use GermplasmName want consider different germplasms corresponding genotype GxE analysis perspective. Lastly, need indicate variable used identify Environments. variables listed environment details unambiguously distinguish different StudyDbIds. case meaningfull variable containing environment names defined environment detail BrAPI source, preferable use studyDbId general just simple number. 3 mandatory variables defined, boxplots trait distribution different environments displayed.  , different options can adjusted fine tune dataset proceeding analysis. Environments can included excluded Environments picker list minimum number environments germplasm must present can set. dataset fully balanced, increasing value trigger exclusion genotypes present environments. lists included excluded geneotypes updated accordingly. Optionally select environment details used location, region, year, environmental scenario. may used analyses especially mixed model section. germplasm attributes can also selected variables used color genotypes different GxE plots.

title: BrAVISE
text: Though common type plots Finlay-Wilkinson analysis “line” type (default), three types plots possible: scatter: creates three scatter plots genotypic mean, square root mean squared deviation sensitivity plotted . trellis: creates trellis plot observations slopes per genotype. set genotypes display must selected germplasm list table, plot. scatterFit: creates scatter plot fitted values trial highest environmental effect fitted values trial lowest environmental effect.

title: BrAVISE
text: plots possible color genotypes variable selected Data Preparation tab. groups germplasms created also possible color germplasm based groups.

title: BrAVISE
text: possible cluster genotypes based sensitivity mean values (). cluster genotypes, first select number clusters (2 8), select whether clustering must done sensitivity geneotype means, together. select clustering method (kmeans hclust) click “Make clusters”.

title: BrAVISE
text: line plot following interaction features: Hover mouse next line: display genotype name right upper corner grey zone Click line point: select (highlight) corresponding genotype plot germplasm list table Double-click anywhere plot: deselect everything Selecting/deselecting row germplasm list table: equivalent clicking line plot Plot options: Equal axes line plot: default line plot equivalent scales x y axes. cases useful deacivate option make wider plot better distinguish environments close means. Plot also non fitted values selected genotypes: one genotypes highlighted possible also display points observed values additionn fitted value (like trellis plot). allow vizualise quality FW model given genotypes quickly difficult read number selected genotypes important.

title: BrAVISE
text: Refer metan statgenGxE manual detailed statistical background. Click first “Run GxE Analysis”

title: BrAVISE
text: following Analysis settings available

title: BrAVISE
text: 0 “none” centering; 1 “global” global centered (E+G+GE); 2 “environment” (default), environment-centered (G+GE); 3 “double” double centred (GE). biplot produced models produced without centering.

title: BrAVISE
text: 0 “none” (default) scaling; 1 “sd” value divided standard deviation corresponding environment (column). put testers roughly range values.

title: BrAVISE
text: 1 “genotype” singular value entirely partitioned genotype eigenvectors, also called row metric preserving; 2 “environment” (default) singular value entirely partitioned environment eigenvectors, also called column metric preserving; 3 “symmetrical” singular value symmetrically partitioned genotype environment eigenvectors SVP often used AMMI analysis biplot analysis, ideal visualizing either relationship among entries among testers.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: STABrAPP application single trial mixed model analysis. provides GUI StatGen-STA R package (https://biometris.github.io/statgenSTA/) data loaded BrAPI compliant systems BMS (Breeding Management System)

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: STABrAPP contains 2 tabs (Data quality Model) accordion tabs called “excluded observations”. accordion lists observations excluded manual selection Data quality tab outliers detection Model tab.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: tab contains 2 dropdown lists (environments trait). can select multiple environments one trait. tabs shows data /plots selected environments trait.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: tab shows distribution plots spatial plots selected environments selected trait.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: can select observations selecting variable value (choose variable value) can manually select data points plot. sidebar appear right selected observations. can select lines exclude selected observations. excluded observations appear purple plots listed accordion .

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: tab shows plot correlations selected environments selected trait

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: tab contains table summary statistics selected trait selected environments.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: model tab enables run single trial analysis selected environments traits. clicking “fit model”, select environments, traits, experimental design model engine. model fitting selected environments traits observations (without excluded observations)

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: Results tab shows left metrics rights calculated Means (BLUES, BLUPS, seBLUEs, seBLUPs) can export metrics clicking “Export CSV”. can send BMS means clicking “Push BLUEs/BLUPs BMS”. push BMS. can select lines table left choose environment trait want push BLUEs/BLUPs.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: Outliers tab shows detected outliers. outlier (bold), can see values measured plot traits. can select outliers want exclude. appear “excluded observations” accordion.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: Fitted models tab shows models summary series four plots: histogram residuals, normal quantile plot residuals, scatter plot residuals fitted values scatter plot absolute residuals fitted values. spatial models, also shows spatial plots.

title: How to use STABrAPP
text: Clicking button Download Report generate report word format. report contains selected trait environment plots, statistics, predicted means calculated fitted model. change selection environments /traits, fit model first able download report.

previous_headings: Use the application with any endpoint
title: Loading data
text: Data import section, user provide details query BrAPI endpoint extract dataset ’s interested . Observation unit levels: either PLOT MEANS, . NB depending application, observation unit level may filtered (e.g. STABrAPP uses PLOT observation level) Study: select study among list available studies (NB: study follows BMS terminology. corresponds trial BrAPI terminology) Available environments: one study selected list environments (studies BrAPI terminology) appears, user expected select one several click Load Selected retrieve corresponding dataset. Alternatively user can click Load load data corresponding environments selected study.

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Boizet , Valette L, Crimi M (2025). shinybrapps: ShinyBrAPPs. R package version 29.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {shinybrapps: ShinyBrAPPs},   author = {Alice Boizet and Léo Valette and Mariano Crimi},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 29.0}, }

title: ShinyBrAPPs
text: ShinyBrAPPs package contains shiny applications designed plant breeders. international collaboration developers CIRAD IBP working together part IAVAO breeders community develop ShinyBrAPPs, support national breeding programs Western Africa. applications can connected datasources implement BrAPI compliant web services. BrAPI, Breeding API standardized application programming interface (API) specification breeding related agricultural data. BrAPI compliance offers systems opportunity add functionalities modular way development external plugin applications can quickly fulfill specific needs group breeders scientists. Currently, ShinyBraPPs applications connected Breeding Management System (BMS) /Gigwa. accessible directly systems interface.

title: ShinyBrAPPs
text: Install remotes package already done Install snpclust package latest development version:

title: ShinyBrAPPs
text: TDxPLOR, trial data explorer, retrieves data multi-location trials displays data counts summary box-plots variables measured different studies. also provides interactive distribution plot easily select observations require curation report candidate issues needs addressed breeder.

title: ShinyBrAPPs
text: STABrAPP application single trial mixed model analysis. basically provides GUI StatgenSTA R package.

title: ShinyBrAPPs
text: BrAVISE application decision support tool helping breeders run GxE analysis, select germplasm according various characteristics save lists selected germplasm BMS

title: ShinyBrAPPs
text: SampleR application allows search samples different entry points (study, germplasm, DbId) print labels.

title: ShinyBrAPPs
text: snpclust enables user check manually correct clustering fluorescence based SNP genotyping data. snpclust included package yet. accessible : https://github.com/jframi/snpclust
